intro: Astripomoea malvacea var. volkensii, commonly known as the Volkensii hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The leaves are broad and ovate, often with a slightly hairy texture.
